storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive real-time alerts for overlapping appointments to prevent double bookings

testCases.title: Validate detection of overlapping appointments with real-time alert
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling system is operational and accessible
At least one existing appointment is present in the system (e.g., Appointment A scheduled from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM)
User has permissions to create and modify appointments
Audit logging is enabled and functioning

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment creation page
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form is displayed with all required fields (date, time, duration, resource)

steps.action: Enter appointment details that overlap with existing Appointment A (e.g., start time 10:30 AM, end time 11:30 AM on the same date)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and fields are populated correctly

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Appointment' button
steps.expectedResult: System detects the time conflict and displays a real-time alert notification with conflict details including overlapping appointment information, time range, and affected resources

steps.action: Review the alert details displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Alert clearly shows the conflicting appointment details, time overlap period, and provides an 'Acknowledge' button or option

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed from the UI and a confirmation message indicates the acknowledgment was recorded

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict audit log or system logs section
steps.expectedResult: Audit log page displays successfully with search and filter options

steps.action: Search for the recent conflict entry using appointment details or timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict log entry is found showing the detected overlap, timestamp of detection, user who acknowledged it, and acknowledgment timestamp

postconditions: Conflict alert has been acknowledged and dismissed
Audit log contains complete record of the conflict detection and acknowledgment
System is ready for next appointment operation
No duplicate log entries exist for the same conflict

testCases.title: Verify system performance under concurrent appointment creations
preconditions: Multiple scheduler users are logged in simultaneously (minimum 5 users)
Scheduling system is operational with normal load
Performance monitoring tools are active and configured
Test data includes multiple overlapping appointment scenarios
System clock is synchronized across all test environments

steps.action: Prepare 10-15 appointment creation requests with intentional overlaps across different time slots
steps.expectedResult: Test data is prepared with documented overlap scenarios and expected conflicts

steps.action: Initiate concurrent appointment creation from multiple scheduler accounts simultaneously (simulate peak load)
steps.expectedResult: All appointment creation requests are submitted to the system within a 2-second window

steps.action: Monitor and record the time taken for each conflict detection alert to appear
steps.expectedResult: All conflict alerts are displayed within 1 second of appointment submission for each overlapping appointment

steps.action: Verify that each scheduler receives alerts relevant to their appointment creations
steps.expectedResult: All schedulers receive their respective conflict alerts promptly with correct conflict details and no missing notifications

steps.action: Check each scheduler's UI for alert delivery completeness
steps.expectedResult: Each scheduler sees only their relevant alerts with complete information about the conflicts

steps.action: Navigate to system logs and error logs section
steps.expectedResult: System logs interface loads successfully showing recent activity

steps.action: Review system logs for any errors, exceptions, or missed conflict detections during the concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: No errors, exceptions, or warnings are present in the logs; all conflicts are logged correctly with accurate timestamps

steps.action: Verify performance metrics show detection latency remained under 1 second threshold
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring data confirms 100% of conflict detections occurred within 1 second latency requirement

postconditions: All concurrent appointments have been processed
All conflicts have been detected and logged
System performance metrics are documented
No system errors or degradation occurred
System has returned to normal operational state

testCases.title: Ensure no alerts for non-overlapping appointments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling system is operational
Existing appointments are present in the system with known time slots
Alert notification system is enabled
System logs are accessible and cleared of previous test data

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment creation page
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Create first appointment with specific time slot (e.g., 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully without any alerts, confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Create second appointment with non-overlapping time slot (e.g., 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM - immediately after first appointment)
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully without any conflict alerts or warnings

steps.action: Create third appointment with completely separate time slot (e.g., 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully with no alerts displayed

steps.action: Verify the UI notification area or alert panel
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alerts or notifications are visible in the UI

steps.action: Navigate to the system logs or conflict log section
steps.expectedResult: Logs interface loads successfully

steps.action: Search for conflict records related to the recently created appointments
steps.expectedResult: No conflict records are found for the non-overlapping appointments; search returns zero results

steps.action: Check the scheduler's notification history or alert inbox
steps.expectedResult: No alert notifications are present for the created appointments; notification area is empty or shows only unrelated items

postconditions: Three non-overlapping appointments exist in the system
No conflict alerts were generated or displayed
System logs contain no conflict records for these appointments
Scheduler received no false positive alerts
System is ready for next test scenario

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive alerts for resource double-bookings to avoid scheduling conflicts

testCases.title: Validate detection of resource double-bookings with alert
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Resource management system is operational
At least one resource exists in the system (e.g., Conference Room A)
An existing appointment has Resource A assigned from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM
User has permissions to assign resources to appointments
Audit logging is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment creation or resource assignment page
steps.expectedResult: Resource assignment interface is displayed with available resources listed

steps.action: Create a new appointment or select an existing appointment for the same time period (10:00 AM to 11:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Appointment form is displayed with resource selection dropdown or field

steps.action: Select and assign the same resource (Resource A) that is already booked for the overlapping time period
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected in the form

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Assign Resource' button
steps.expectedResult: System detects the resource double-booking and immediately displays a real-time alert with conflict details including resource name, conflicting appointment details, and time overlap

steps.action: Review the alert notification displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Alert clearly shows the resource conflict details, including resource name, both conflicting appointments, time ranges, and provides an 'Acknowledge' option

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed from the UI and system displays confirmation that acknowledgment was recorded

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict audit log or resource conflict log section
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully with filter and search capabilities

steps.action: Search for the recent resource conflict entry using resource name or timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict log entry is displayed showing the resource double-booking details, detection timestamp, conflicting appointments, user who acknowledged, and acknowledgment timestamp

postconditions: Resource double-booking alert has been acknowledged
Complete audit trail exists for the conflict detection and acknowledgment
System is ready for next resource assignment operation
Resource conflict is documented in the system logs

testCases.title: Verify no alerts for non-conflicting resource assignments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Resource management system is operational
Multiple resources are available in the system (e.g., Conference Room A, Conference Room B, Projector 1)
Some existing appointments with resource assignments are present
Alert system is enabled and functioning

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment creation page
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form is displayed with resource assignment options

steps.action: Create first appointment and assign Resource A for time slot 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully with Resource A assigned, no alerts are displayed, confirmation message appears

steps.action: Create second appointment and assign Resource B (different resource) for the same time slot 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully with Resource B assigned, no conflict alerts are generated

steps.action: Create third appointment and assign Resource A for a non-overlapping time slot 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully with Resource A assigned for the new time slot, no alerts are displayed

steps.action: Verify the UI notification area for any alerts
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alerts or notifications are visible in the user interface

steps.action: Navigate to the system logs or resource conflict logs section
steps.expectedResult: Logs interface loads successfully

steps.action: Search for conflict records related to the recently assigned resources
steps.expectedResult: No conflict records are found for the non-conflicting resource assignments; search returns zero conflict entries

steps.action: Check the scheduler's notification panel or alert history
steps.expectedResult: No alert notifications are present; notification area shows no resource conflict alerts for the created appointments

postconditions: Multiple appointments with non-conflicting resource assignments exist in the system
No false positive alerts were generated
System logs contain no conflict records for these resource assignments
Resources are correctly assigned without conflicts
System is ready for next test

testCases.title: Test system performance under concurrent resource assignments
preconditions: Multiple scheduler users are logged in simultaneously (minimum 5 users)
Resource management system is operational under normal load
Multiple resources are available for assignment
Performance monitoring tools are configured and active
Test scenarios include intentional resource conflicts prepared
System time is synchronized across all test clients

steps.action: Prepare 10-15 resource assignment scenarios with intentional double-bookings across different resources and time slots
steps.expectedResult: Test data is prepared with documented conflict scenarios and expected outcomes

steps.action: Initiate concurrent resource assignments from multiple scheduler accounts simultaneously to simulate peak usage
steps.expectedResult: All resource assignment requests are submitted to the system within a 2-second window

steps.action: Monitor and record the time taken for each conflict detection alert to appear for conflicting assignments
steps.expectedResult: All resource conflict alerts are displayed within 1 second of resource assignment submission

steps.action: Verify that each scheduler receives alerts for their respective resource conflicts
steps.expectedResult: All schedulers receive their relevant conflict alerts promptly with accurate resource conflict details

steps.action: Check each scheduler's UI to confirm alert delivery and content accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Each scheduler sees only their relevant resource conflict alerts with complete and accurate information

steps.action: Navigate to system logs and error logs section
steps.expectedResult: System logs interface loads successfully showing recent resource assignment activity

steps.action: Review logs for any errors, exceptions, or missed conflict detections during concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: No errors, exceptions, or warnings are present; all resource conflicts are logged correctly with accurate timestamps and details

steps.action: Analyze performance metrics to verify detection latency remained under 1 second
steps.expectedResult: Performance data confirms 100% of resource conflict detections occurred within the 1 second latency requirement

steps.action: Verify no conflicts were missed during the concurrent load test
steps.expectedResult: All intentional conflicts are accounted for in the logs and alerts; detection accuracy is 100%

postconditions: All concurrent resource assignments have been processed
All resource conflicts have been detected and alerted
Performance metrics are documented and meet requirements
No system errors or performance degradation occurred
System has returned to normal operational state
Complete audit trail exists for all operations
